Module 3: Persistence with Hibernate & Spring Data JPA

Module 3: Persistence with Hibernate & Spring Data JPA

A backend application is incomplete without a database. This module introduces the data layer, focusing on how Java interacts with databases in a robust, type-safe way using an Object-Relational Mapper (ORM). We will explore Hibernate and the Java Persistence API (JPA) specification, comparing them to familiar tools like Prisma or Sequelize.

Lessons in this Module

  • Lesson 3.1: Intro to ORM & JPA - What is an ORM and why is it used? An introduction to the Java Persistence API (JPA) specification.
  • Lesson 3.2: Entities - Defining your database models as Java classes using the @Entity annotation.
  • Lesson 3.3: Repositories with Spring Data JPA - The magic of creating complex database queries simply by defining interface methods.
  • Lesson 3.4: Relationships - Modeling database relationships like @OneToMany and @ManyToOne between your entities.
